sentences.sContent: The army has come under attack by separatists.
sentences.sCn: 军队遭到独立分子的袭击。

sentences.sContent: Spanish police say they have arrested ten people suspected of being members of the Basque separatist movement.
sentences.sCn: 西班牙警方说，他们已经逮捕了10名巴斯克独立运动的嫌疑分子。

words.tran: 分开的；分居；不在一起生活的
分离性的；倾向分离的；区别性的
分离，分开；间隔，距离；[法] 分居；缺口
分开；隔开（separate的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: someone who belongs to a group that wants to start a new country with its own government, by separating from the country that they belong to now
Separatist organizations and activities within a country involve members of a group of people who want to establish their own separate government or are trying to do so
